address: Xã Tả Thàng, Huyện Mường Khương, Tỉnh Lào Cai
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Address Mapping**

Okay, so I'm tasked with mapping the old address "Xã Tả Thàng, Huyện Mường Khương, Tỉnh Lào Cai" to its new equivalent. My approach will be methodical, leveraging my understanding of Vietnamese administrative structures and the provided resolutions.

First, the province is straightforward: "Tỉnh Lào Cai."  I quickly verified that Lào Cai wasn't subject to any province-level mergers or name changes via the provided resolutions. The resolution 60-NQ/TW doesn't indicate any changes. I'm certain this part.

Next, I zeroed in on the ward level. "Xã Tả Thàng" is what I need to identify.  I diligently searched through the "Other resolutions," specifically looking for mentions of "Xã Tả Thàng" within the context of "Tỉnh Lào Cai." Resolution 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning administrative adjustments in Lào Cai, was the key here.  Line 79 was crucial: it explicitly states that "Xã Tả Thàng" is part of the merger that creates "Xã Cao Sơn."  This confirms the change.

To validate my findings, I cross-referenced the "New wards" data.  I was looking specifically for "Xã Cao Sơn." And there it was!  A direct match with the ward code "02782." This provides further confirmation of the mapping, bolstering my confidence. The original "Xã Tả Thàng" doesn't appear as a separate entity in the "New wards" list, which aligns perfectly with it being merged into "Xã Cao Sơn."

Therefore, my final output will reflect this mapping: "Xã Tả Thàng" now corresponds to "Xã Cao Sơn" with ward code "02782," within the province of "Tỉnh Lào Cai."  My citation will point directly to the relevant line in Resolution 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15.  Given the clear direct reference in the resolution and the corroborating data, I'm highly confident in this mapping.

citation.header: 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lào Cai
citation.line: 79. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Lùng Khấu Nhin, Tả Thàng, La Pan Tẩn và Cao Sơn thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Cao Sơn.
